newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Banks Assn ups deposit rates by 25 BP.
newsitem.headline: HK Banks Assn ups deposit rates by 25 BP.

text.p: The Hong Kong Association of Bank said it raised short-term deposit rates by 25 basis points on Wednesday following Tuesday's 25-basis point increase in U.S. rates and firmer local money market rates.
Maximum rates payable for short-term retail deposits in Hong Kong dollars by licensed banks were raised 25 points to four percent for savings and 24-hours' call/notice, the HKAB said.

"This is to follow the move that happened overnight in the United States," said HKAB chairman Chris Langley. "I think the increase of 25 basis points has been very largely factored in by the market over the last few days."
The U.S. Federal Reserve increased the Federal funds rate to 5.50 percent on Tuesday but left the discount rate unchanged.
Langley said he expected to see at least one more rate increase this year.

"Most people, myself included, believe that it is more than likely that at least one more rate increase will be seen this year and that will probably be of around 25 basis points as well," Langley said.
